website_summaries.verdict: A solid pick if you want a permanent option, but if you don't like the idea of hammering them into your furniture, look elsewhere.
pros: Handles up to 1,600 pounds and moves over most surfaces
A permanent design that stays in place once installed
cons: Installation requires tools and can be difficult for people who can't lift large or heavy objects
Some owners note slight floor scratches after using them

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Original Specification
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy tap-in replacement slider is just right for replacing worn out original sliders on furniture legs. Surface area on this is a significant bit wider than the originals on my chair legs so it distributes weight and wear better. The nail is the same but the glide part is of superior material that was used on my craftsman made furniture..
customer_reviews.author: James EllsworthTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Carpet
customer_reviews.text: My awkward apartment has a carpeted kitchen. I put these on our dinning chairs. They slide well enough that I do not get aggravated every time i sit at the table. The carpet is similar to what you find in an office space. These do require drilling small holes prior to placing on feet.
customer_reviews.author: Nessa

customer_reviews.title: 5/64" drill bit helps and cover plastic with dish towel
customer_reviews.text: We are trying these out on our chairs which are on a wood floor. We're hoping that they don't scratch the floor over time. They seem to be working fine now. Here are a few possible tips. I used a 5/64" drill bit to create pilot holes. This made it easier to hammer the sliders in. Instead of hammering directly on the plastic, I used some dish towels to cover the plastic as I hammered. I didn't want to scratch the plastic with my hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not A Magic Wand
customer_reviews.text: They help our chairs to slide on thick carpet. I was hoping for something that would work more like "moving men", but I think it would take a much larger slider to do that. it's just a problem inherent in thick carpet. We do see some improvement in the mobility of the chairs, just not as much as we had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: chocolate

customer_reviews.title: Left marks on my wood floor
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Easy to attach Con: I pushed a chair gently to see how well it would glide.... and the result was a gray mark from the slider on my cherry floor. Now I'm back to square one, looking for some glides that won't mar my wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B

customer_reviews.title: My dining room chairs actually slide now!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I have wood look tile floors. The floor appears to be level but somehow my dining room chairs seem to find the 1/16" grout line and suddenly stop sliding. It's really frustrating. I ordered these and now the chairs easily slide without getting stuck. Additionally, my dining room chairs do not make the loud ugly noise when sliding anymore. Such a small thing but I'm so happy I purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: These work great and is so easy to slide
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on our dining chairs on tile. We previously used those soft ones, but they got stuck on the grout when you tried to scoot in/out and would constantly fall off. These work great and is so easy to slide. They go over the grout without a problem. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cecile Roberts

customer_reviews.title: This brand is great! I've used this one
customer_reviews.text: This brand is great! I've used this one, which has to be tapped in with a hammer, as well as another kind that is installed with a screw driver. Both are very effective at saving our linoleum (kitchen table and chairs) and hardwood floors (couch and chair).
customer_reviews.author: Polycarp

customer_reviews.title: works great on wood floors, good value but pre-drill holes
customer_reviews.text: Slides nicely on my hardwood floors and leaves no marks. I was trying to find tiny castors but they cost a bundle. These slides do the job nicely at a fraction of the price. Note: Since the chair was made of hardwood I found it best to pre-drill the holes with a smaller drill bit so it would still fit tight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Magic Sliders are the way to go, hands down.
customer_reviews.text: These sliders are amazing. I used to have the felt stick on pads under my dining room chairs, until the glue failed and I ended up with sticky glue streaks under the chairs... I tore them all off, put these on in their place, and am a happy camper. The chairs slide on the hardwood floor smoothly and with little effort. I should have gone this route from the beginning. 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Erroneous

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I was quite hesitant about this product when I was looking to purchase it, but I decided to do it anyway. I have a chair on thin carpeting that did not slide easily (at all). Installation took 5 minutes and the chair glides SO smooth over the carpeting. Best purchase in a while-- a must!
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Make chores a bit easier....
customer_reviews.text: Just love these sliders, I can move chairs around on my tile floor with one hand to mop or sweep. I like the hard glides more than the felt, they are much cleaner and when mopping I don't worry about the glides getting wet.
customer_reviews.author: Justme

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality product!
customer_reviews.text: High quality, easily installed. I only wish I would of measured a second time because I could of used ones that were a bit bigger, but that’s on me.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works well on Pergo - so far
customer_reviews.text: East to install, works very well on a Pergo floor. Just enough resistance to keep you from sliding around too much. A friend told me to keep the floor clean though. Small particles of dirt, etc. can embed themselves, then scratch the floor when you slide the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano 1951

customer_reviews.title: Sliding a bit easier
customer_reviews.text: These function really well and are small enough so I don't have to see them. Great for furniture that is on carpet and needs to be moved around. Only complaint here is that they start getting beat up when I tap them in with a hammer. Suggest using a rubber mallet.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Alan

customer_reviews.title: These slide the smoothest
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for daily used chairs on tile floors, after trying several other brands, these slide the easiest. The only potential problem is the tacks are rather small so if you're replacing other worn out pads that were nailed in, you may need to glue them in like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Don Quixote

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the stick on ones and after a few months they started coming off. Then I bought the 2-part ones # 08221. I did drill a pilot hole before putting the nail in. The directions say to flex the cap a few times before putting it on. Then put on over one lip at a time. I didn't and no way could I put in on. Then I read the directions and followed them. With my 65 year-old grandmother's hands with arthritis this took some time, but they went on easily after that. My husband says he has to be careful how fast he pushes back from the table or he will fly right out the window.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried the felt ones which were a total waste in actual help and also slid out after a ...
customer_reviews.text: Where have you been all my life! My wooden dining chairs had 'sliders' on them but oh what a challenge on the ear to actually slide them on tile. Tried the felt ones which were a total waste in actual help and also slid out after a month. These are so much better, just hammered then right into the other sliders.
customer_reviews.author: Raspberry

customer_reviews.title: These sliders saved my hardwood floors!
customer_reviews.text: Noticed an immediate improvement in the way my kitchen and dining room chairs move on the hardwood floor. We no longer have to worry about scratching the floors. These are easy to install. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ShenValley

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth on glide over hardwood or smooth floors
customer_reviews.text: These work very well for their intended purpose and save your floors.
customer_reviews.author: DeepThought

customer_reviews.title: Easily replaced the old non nylon glides on our Kitchen ...
customer_reviews.text: Easily replaced the old non nylon glides on our Kitchen chair set.and much quieter, easier on hard floors. Not much improvement on carpet. Installed easily in pilot hole with rubber mallet.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Bachtel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sliders!
customer_reviews.text: These sliders are way better than any sliders I have used in the past. We have heavy wood dining room chairs that move so smoothly and easy when sitting down or getting up from the table with these sliders attached to the legs.
customer_reviews.author: JoyceMI

customer_reviews.title: Self stick Super Sliders worked better for ease of movement
customer_reviews.text: Self stick Super Sliders worked better for ease of movement. Would recommend those instead although they are larger and can be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Magic Sliders for Kitchen Chairs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the same ones I bought many years ago for my kitchen chairs. They do help my chairs slide more easily on my Kitchen tile floor. But as with most things that you apply friction to, they will wear out over time. In comparison, I use felt for the Dining Chairs for my Bamboo flooring. You'll never go wrong with Magic Sliders. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: GMC '05

customer_reviews.title: VERY BAD NEW DESIGN !!!
customer_reviews.text: Very bad design, the nail comes apart from the slider part when you hit it with a hammer in order to put it in the chair leg, you are then left with a sharp nail end sticking out of the chair leg. I liked the old design where you nailed a plastic part onto the chair leg and then attached the "magic slider" with your hand by pushing it onto the plastic part you nailed on. Not good to need multiple packs to get 8 for 2 chairs. EXTREMELY UNHAPPY WITH NEW DESIGN !!!
customer_reviews.author: PattyAnn

customer_reviews.title: Great product, hard to find now in big box stores.
customer_reviews.text: The original 'Majic Sliders' like these have the base that is held on by small nails/brads, and the slider which fits over the base. When the slider wears out, you can just replace it on the existing base. The new ones are glued on (self stick), and are much less capable. I originally thought these were priced a bit high, but after considering the options, they are a fair value. I've stocked up on them since I think they are now obsolete.
customer_reviews.author: MatBo911

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow kitchen with cabinets on both sides and a trash can and recycle container on a laminate floor in between the lower cabinets. Every time I open a cabinet door I have to move both containers, and I was worried about the floor being damaged. Because the containers had plastic bottoms I couldn't use the nail-in sliders, so I tried these. They were easy to apply and have a very strong adhesive. They do the job at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie brooklyn girl

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: They are OK. They did not wok on my tile floor with wide deep grout joints. They just got stuck in the joints and got scratched up. They would probably work on a regular floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used these on chairs I refinished
customer_reviews.text: Love how my floor doesn't get scratched and yet the chair glides across it. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: KMHS

customer_reviews.title: WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Works so much better than the felt pads or any self sticking pads, they don't slide off or move.
customer_reviews.author: M. Worcester

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: I have wooden bar stools at a kitchen counter above a ceramic tile floor. These glides enabled them to slide with ease. And, they're much quieter when pulled out from the counter. Do drill pilot holes in the chair legs slightly smaller than the nail size to minimize the chance of the wood splitting, and to ensure that they install on-center. The pilot hole lets you tap the glides in easily, making installation a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Osterstock

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these as a replacement for sliders we installed a decade ago. The old sliders were worn out and a few of the "holders" had to be replaced. There is a little trick to placing the sliders on to the holder, but it was an easy project. The best part was that our chairs were sliding again! (in fact until they wore in a little, we would sit at the table and the chairs would slide away!)
customer_reviews.author: SKYE

customer_reviews.title: This item prevents our kitchen chairs from scratching the wood floor.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for item that would stay firmly attached to the chair legs and allow the chairs to glide across the wood floor. This product was the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't expect miracles
customer_reviews.text: Works just like they say, it is a one peace nail on glide, if using on smooth surface works great it is not made for rough or uneven surfaces, on my deep carpet it makes it easier to pull out chairs but when you sit in chair they sink into carpet they can't stop that, but they do make it better to move the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L Haizlip

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Kitchen chairs have never slid so easy!
customer_reviews.author: D. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the great reviews of this product, I have been very disappointed. The chairs slid very nicely on our wood floors for a few days, but now they rub on the floors just as much as they did with nothing on, and I notice that the floors are continuing to get worn. I guess old fashioned felt is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: NCEllen

customer_reviews.title: they work great on any surface
customer_reviews.text: these sliders are great my wooden chairs move alot better with these than the stick on felt.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B.

customer_reviews.title: They Work And Make Me Superman
customer_reviews.text: We love these. We had a couch with feet that marked the floor when we turned the couch between TV watching and social settings. We tried felt pads and they were better, but still left some marks. Now, we have no marks and my wife can turn the couch while I'm sitting on it and I can turn it empty with fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Scratched my floor.
customer_reviews.text: These things scratched my floors. When I looked at them carefully, I could see a little nubs in the plastic that were probably manufacturing defects. Those nubs put several larger scratches in my floor as I moved my chair. Terrible product. Going back to using felt.
customer_reviews.author: Jared van Aalten

customer_reviews.title: Much better than stick on variety
customer_reviews.text: I've used the stick on version of these before and, inevitably, they come off. I got these and drilled a tiny hole in the bottom of each chair leg then placed the nail part in and used a hammer to tap them in. Easy installation and works great.
customer_reviews.author: AngieG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had new bar stood and these really did help them to slide on the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: grasshopperdidit

customer_reviews.title: Love magic Sliders!
customer_reviews.text: I put 2 on each leg of my chair that sits on a very short woven rug in the kitchen. The chair shoots across the floor now with minimal effort. I'll be ordering more.. Just wish I found some rectangular ones with 2 nails in it. but 2 on each rectangular leg works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Caswell

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: Easy to attach to chair legs with light hammer taps.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Not the item pictured
customer_reviews.text: This item is not the one pictured. The picture shows a two part system. I was looking to replace the pads on my older Magic Sliders, but they sent the one piece, nail-on, sliders. That is inferior because it won't swivel to provide accurate surface connection. I want the ones in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Lapage Jo

customer_reviews.title: Using on carpet
customer_reviews.text: These work better than the ones that were on my dining room chairs when I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sliders
customer_reviews.text: Nice sliders for our dining room chairs. What made them extra special was the fact that the nail points were shielded with a rubber cap so no accidents until you are ready to attach them. They work great too.
customer_reviews.author: Dick

customer_reviews.title: Makes it easy to slide chairs and other furniture
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the pads that I installed in the past on a set of dining room chairs. I'm using them on ceramic tiles with fairly wide, rough grout, so they tend to wear out in a year or so. I can pop off the worn out sliders and snap on the replacements. (I don't use the mounting hardware, as I had already installed those.) The included nails are not the best way to attach the sliders to chair legs. Vibration tends to loosen them. And, on a narrow chair leg, it's important to drill a pilot hole to prevent splitting. Instead of the nails, I use small wood screws and enlarged the hole in the mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne & Jackie Seltzer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on my heavy oak dining chairs
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfectly for me. I was afraid they would get caught on my tile's larger grout lines, but I had no issues. I bought a second set for the rest of my chairs. Makes using my heavy oak dining chairs SO much easier.
customer_reviews.author: The Brooks Stead

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing on my dining room chairs to easily glide across rug.
customer_reviews.author: Woodlandsguys

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Easy to install and make the chairs slide effortlessly over carpets and hard woods.
customer_reviews.author: Shellieme

customer_reviews.title: Great floor protectors
customer_reviews.text: Saving my floors- wood & carpet! Easy to install (just need a hammer)
customer_reviews.author: Amcg

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! They do not scuff mark up your floors would definitely recommend .
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I don't have any experience with various chair glides, but these definitely work. I started with the stick on kind by magic sliders, but they fell off my chairs immediately so I got the nail on kind this time around.
customer_reviews.author: Sirenyard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Low profile, and exactly what we needed on our tile floor.
customer_reviews.author: MeBee

customer_reviews.title: Not for wood floors
customer_reviews.text: Description said for hard floors but caused scratches on my oak hardwood
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough.
customer_reviews.text: These sliders work pretty well on my ceramic tile floor. They are so easy to install. Don't know how well they will last. The delivery was swift.
customer_reviews.author: Don L. Parce

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, but would have preferred a 1" diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky731

customer_reviews.title: Useless on quartz tile floor
customer_reviews.text: Although sliders were labelled for use with tile floors, they did not work on my quartz floors--no glide whatsoever. They are no different than the felt pads I had on my chairs previously--total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula Stritzel

customer_reviews.title: allowed a good fit on our chair
customer_reviews.text: Work well....strong nail, allowed a good fit on our chair.
customer_reviews.author: Terry & Phyl

customer_reviews.title: Chairs glide easily with Magic Sliders
customer_reviews.text: The glides were easy to install. They make the chairs glide very easily on my wood floors but don't leave any marks. They arrived on time and in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M

customer_reviews.title: A simple modern design, that work brilliantly.
customer_reviews.text: L O V E !!! Simple modern design, made of quality materials. We're using them for chairs that sit on old oriental rugs in our home. And they work brilliantly!!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne G

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly what I needed in this application, but the product is fine
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: i like them much better than the model that has the ...
customer_reviews.text: these work well and i will get more. i like them much better than the model that has the plastic piece that nails into the leg and then the cover snaps on top of that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The new sliders are horrible quality. The nail part snaps off making them ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the sliders we've had on our dining room chairs for years. The old ones were finally wearing out after heavy use. The new sliders are horrible quality. The nail part snaps off making them worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Wife thought they were the snap on replacement ones like we now have
customer_reviews.text: Wife thought they were the snap on replacement ones like we now have. They have to be nailed on.
customer_reviews.author: RAS

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect on our dining room chairs. We removed the worn ones and put these on. Very easy to do!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne R. Mcnaughton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the metal pin rather than the sticky type. These really stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Nailing Magic Sliders to furniture is the best way to move furniture, ever!
customer_reviews.text: When Magic Sliders are nailed to wood chairs and furniture; when in place, it is very easy to move the furniture on carpet or wood.
customer_reviews.author: SwedeDC

customer_reviews.title: Best sliders ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for the perfect sliders that move freely and don't make any noise for my kitchen tile floor and these are it!!! Worth every penny and easy to put on! What a great product! I've ordered for all my chairs and the annoying screeching has stopped!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not much improvement in sliding on carpet for dining room chairs
customer_reviews.text: Not much better than the wood bottoms of my dining room chairs on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Y

customer_reviews.title: Use a ruler.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice but were smaller than I expected. I should have used a ruler to measure for the size I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: juliawillc

customer_reviews.title: Great for Wooden Chairs on Hardwood Floor
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what I needed, hard to find in stores. They're sturdy and work great for chairs on a hardwood floor.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Mac

customer_reviews.title: No more scratched floors
customer_reviews.text: Best solution to move any piece of furniture. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Yaser A.

customer_reviews.title: These sliders are not the ones pictured!
customer_reviews.text: I have three piece sliders - shown in the picture. I have worn out several sliders and was looking to replace the discs. What arrived was just standard nail on sliders. Very disappointed and not worth sending back. Please update the photos and description.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Sliders for tile floor
customer_reviews.text: Attaches easy. Wanted them for tile floor. Sliders work well but thought they would slide a bit easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, however way to small for my dining chairs. I'll have to find muck larger sliders.
customer_reviews.author: My shoe

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for tile floors and stay in place
customer_reviews.text: Never realized some of the chair protectors from Magic Sliders are only for carpets! These are perfect for tile floors and stay in place. The capped ones always fell off and wore out unevenly. So very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: speedycj

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and works well with no problems
customer_reviews.author: jennifer smith

customer_reviews.title: They really work!
customer_reviews.text: These sliders make moving dining room chairs over carpet a total breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn’t help.
customer_reviews.text: My chairs are very heavy and on carpeting. Was expecting these would help them to move easily. They did not.
customer_reviews.author: Befree1

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Working well so far for my old wicker chairs on the lanai.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D. Bollers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to install and will save my chair legs.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and durable. Easy to use. Makes it much easier to move furniture and saves flooring and carpets
customer_reviews.author: Belkys

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These worked out perfectly and I'm glad that I found them here.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Bronco

customer_reviews.title: A Magical Sliding Experience But A Few Sore Thumbs
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to "nail in," but once in they really work. Our chairs slide like magic now.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Hebron

customer_reviews.title: Great on Tile
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and work great on my tile floors.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great product, put them on all my wood kitchen chairs and they slide great on ceramic tile floor.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT RITCHIE

customer_reviews.title: magic gliders
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't exactly what I wanted, but, was able to use them.
customer_reviews.author: rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They work as advertised. If you need them, get some.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great for protecting my wood floors. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: SandyBeach4me

customer_reviews.title: furniture on ceramic
customer_reviews.text: chair leg on ceramic floor. replaced metal caps on chair leg bottoms great product
customer_reviews.author: james caito

customer_reviews.title: Great solution
customer_reviews.text: The sliders provided the solution I was looking for. They installed very easily and and slide well.
customer_reviews.author: teacherfan

customer_reviews.title: Just like MAJIC
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT even on my heavy kitchen chairs on carpeting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received a different, but similar product than what is pictured
customer_reviews.text: I love Magic Sliders and have been using them for over 10 years. I like the product pictured (sliders with a center support where you then attach the slider on to), but I received a different product. I had to remove the old support system and apply the new design. The sliders work about 75% as good as the older design. It isn't as 'silky-smooth' of a movement across my wood floors. Don't know why they changed the design. They didn't ask my opinion! I am still a fan of this company, though.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: ... install wheels on my couch but these sliders work great.
customer_reviews.text: I was going to install wheels on my couch but these sliders work great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey vesci

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: don't slide as well as i would like but may hold up better then original. fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Had to send back, not what I expected, had to use drill to get them started
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Aslanian

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on my new chairs. Perfect size and shape. Chairs now slide easily on carpet. Would purchase again if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Kem Pence

customer_reviews.title: They are not as good as the old ones
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing some worn-out Magic sliders. The old ones were softer, and grit didn't seem to get into them as much as these newer ones. They are not as good as the old ones. Bring back the old design.
customer_reviews.author: Rick May

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: does exactly as it states...pretty simple. can't describe this any other way. if you need them, this works for you!
customer_reviews.author: Get Rung

product_meta.title: Magic Sliders 08221 22mm (7/8-Inch) Furniture Glide Round Nail On Sliding Disc 8 count
product_meta.description: Used for all types of wooden chairs and tables with legs. Moves up to 1600 pounds across vinyl, ceramic tiles, wood floors and carpeting. Will not scratch floors. With nails.
feature_bullets: Used for all types of wooden chairs and tables with legs.
Moves up to 1600 pounds across vinyl, ceramic tiles, wood floors and carpeting.
Will not scratch floors with nails.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars221 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
